page.title: 12CHURCH SUNDIALS
page.content: The font is ancient and consists of a circular tub of sandstone on a stepped base and a high octagonal plinth and it is generally thought it could be 12th century. The most notable feature of this church was a sundial which is now housed in St.Laurence's church. This sundial,or possibly,Mass Dial's fame arises from the fact that it is one of only three in England in which the lower part is divided into tenths. Saxons divided their day into eight. One of these three sundials is at Old Byland which used to have an inscription on it which was undoubtedly Saxon. There are other decimal sundials in Scandinavia,schools believe it dates from about 850 AD.
